vialab.simpleMultiTouch.events

Class RotateEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.simpleMultiTouch.events.TuioEvent
      • vialab.simpleMultiTouch.events.RotateEvent

  • public class RotateEvent
extends TuioEvent
    Holds the information associated with a rotate event.

    University of Ontario Institute of Technology. Summer Research Assistant with Dr. Christopher Collins (Summer 2011) collaborating with Dr. Mark Hancock.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Erik Paluka

      Constructors

      RotateEvent(int x, int y, long[] cursors, int xPofRotation, int yPofRotation, float angle)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RotateEvent

        public RotateEvent(int x,
           int y,
           long[] cursors,
           int xPofRotation,
           int yPofRotation,
           float angle)
        Calls the constructor of TuioEvent and passes it the event's coordinates and the cursors associated with the event. It also saves the point of rotation, and the rotation angle in variables.
        Parameters:
        x - int - The x-coordinate of the event
        y - int - The y-coordinate of the event
        cursors - long[] - The cursors involved in the event (their session IDs)
        xPofRotation - int - The x-coordinate of the point of rotation
        yPofRotation - int - The y-coordinate of the point of rotation
        angle - float - The angle of rotation

    • Method Detail

      • getXPofRotation

        public int getXPofRotation()
        Gets the x-coordinate from the point of rotation
        Returns:
        xPofRotation int - X-coordinate of rotation

      • getYPofRotation

        public int getYPofRotation()
        Gets the y-coordinate from the point of rotation
        Returns:
        yPofRotation int - Y-coordinate of rotation

      • getAngle

        public float getAngle()
        Gets the angle of rotation.
        Returns:
        angle - float
